rules.description: The RFP must clearly and specifically define the project scope, objectives, and all deliverables to avoid ambiguity and ensure comparable proposals.
rules.incorrect_pattern: Writing a requirement like: 'We need a new customer relationship management system.'
rules.correct_pattern: Specifying: 'The CRM must integrate with our existing accounting software (X), support 50 concurrent users, and provide automated weekly reporting on sales pipelines as defined in Appendix A.'

rules.description: The RFP must include specific, probing questions that require vendors to demonstrate their expertise, rather than allowing for simple 'yes/no' answers.
rules.incorrect_pattern: Asking: 'Does your solution support multi-factor authentication?'
rules.correct_pattern: Asking: 'Describe your solution's approach to multi-factor authentication, list all supported methods, and detail the end-user enrollment process.'

rules.description: The RFP must transparently outline the exact criteria for evaluation and the specific weighting of each criterion to ensure a fair process.
rules.incorrect_pattern: Stating that 'proposals will be evaluated based on a combination of cost and technical merit.'
rules.correct_pattern: Including a table in the RFP: Technical Solution (40%), Cost (30%), Vendor Experience & References (20%), Security Compliance (10%).

rules.description: A clear, realistic timeline for the entire RFP process, from vendor questions to the final decision, must be explicitly stated.
rules.incorrect_pattern: Providing only a final submission deadline without key dates for questions or decisions.
rules.correct_pattern: Publishing a full schedule: RFP Issued (Date), Vendor Questions Due (Date), Answers Published (Date), Proposals Due (Date), Final Decision Announced (Date).

rules.description: The RFP must dictate a mandatory, standardized format or provide a template for all proposal submissions to ensure fair and simple side-by-side comparison.
rules.incorrect_pattern: Allowing vendors to submit proposals in their own branding and format.
rules.correct_pattern: Stating: 'All proposals must use the provided template in Appendix B and adhere to the section order and page limits specified.'

rules.description: The RFP must establish a formal, centralized communication protocol for all vendor questions, ensuring all participants receive the same information.
rules.incorrect_pattern: Answering vendor questions individually via various emails or phone calls.
rules.correct_pattern: Stating: 'All questions must be submitted to procurement@company.com by the deadline. A document containing all questions and their answers will be distributed to all participating vendors.'

rules.description: The RFP must require vendors to comply with all applicable data privacy laws (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) and detail their data handling, storage, and breach notification protocols.
rules.incorrect_pattern: Omitting any mention of data security or privacy requirements.
rules.correct_pattern: Including a dedicated 'Data Security' section requiring vendors to describe their security architecture, encryption standards, and incident response plan.

rules.description: The RFP must stipulate the minimum types and levels of insurance coverage required (e.g., Cyber Liability, E&O) and state that proof will be required before contracting.
rules.incorrect_pattern: Not specifying insurance requirements, leaving it to be negotiated after vendor selection.
rules.correct_pattern: Stating: 'As a condition of the contract, vendors must provide a COI showing active Cyber Liability coverage of at least $5M and E&O coverage of at least $2M.'

rules.description: The RFP must state that vendors must comply with all relevant laws and ethical standards, and require adherence to the company's Supplier Code of Conduct.
rules.incorrect_pattern: Assuming vendors will adhere to ethical standards without an explicit requirement.
rules.correct_pattern: Including a clause: 'The selected vendor must agree to and sign our Supplier Code of Conduct (see Appendix C) prior to contract execution.'

rules.description: The RFP must reserve the company's right to audit the vendor's processes and records to ensure compliance with contractual and regulatory obligations.
rules.incorrect_pattern: Failing to mention the possibility of future audits in the RFP terms.
rules.correct_pattern: Including a 'Right to Audit' clause in the terms and conditions section of the RFP, giving your company the right to perform security and compliance audits.

rules.description: The RFP must require vendors to propose specific, measurable, and quantifiable Service Level Agreements (SLAs) and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).
rules.incorrect_pattern: Accepting a vague vendor promise of 'excellent customer support' or 'high availability.'
rules.correct_pattern: Requiring vendors to complete a table specifying their proposed SLA for metrics like 'System Uptime (%)', 'Average Support Ticket Response Time (Hours)', and 'Resolution Time for Critical Issues'.

rules.description: The RFP should state that the final contract will include remedies or penalties (e.g., service credits) for failing to meet the agreed-upon SLAs.
rules.incorrect_pattern: Leaving consequences for poor performance unstated in the RFP, making it harder to negotiate later.
rules.correct_pattern: Stating: 'The proposal must describe the vendor's proposed service credit structure for any failure to meet the required SLAs for uptime and support response.'
